A pensioner who was killed after being hit by a lorry in Cheetham Hill has been named as 70-year-old Mansoor Ahmed. 
Part of Cheetham Hill Road, outside Trinity United Church, was closed off by police after the man was struck by the HGV at about 2pm on Tuesday afternoon. 
Police have confirmed the crash victim was Mr Ahmed, who had been a resident at the Nada Nursing Home on Cheetham Hill Road since 2015. 
Eyewitnesses expressed their shock after seeing the pensioner struck by the lorry. He was taken to hospital but sadly died. The scene of the fatal crash on Cheetham Hill Road Read More Recap: Pensioner dies after being hit by lorry in Cheetham Hill 
One man, who knew Mr Ahmed, said: “He was well known to people around here. 
“We would often see him on Cheetham Hill Road here. He was a very elderly gentleman who had lived here for the last 30 or 40 years. 
“I saw it all happen. He was a family friend. It was very sad.” 
The road was closed while crash investigators from Greater Manchester Police inspected the scene of the incident. 
A man has been arrested on suspicion on causing death by careless driving and remains in custody for questioning. 
Police are now appealing for witnesses to the crash to come forward. Part of Cheetham Hill Road, outside Trinity United Church, was closed off by police Read More Footballer 'performed sex acts with girl he groomed' after meeting at school tournament, court hears 
PC Paul Hailwood, of GMP’s Serious Collision Investigation Unit, said: “This is a tragic set of circumstances that has led to the death of an elderly man. “Our thoughts are with his family at this difficult time and they are being supported by specially trained officers. 
“We have one man in custody but our investigation continues. I would like to appeal to anyone who was in the area at the time and saw anything to come forward. 
“I am particularly keen to speak to anyone who may have dashcam footage of the collision to please contact us.” Like us on Facebook
